cycloneMessage.systemGeoRefPt1: ABOUT 640 MI...1025 KM WSW OF THE SOUTHERN TIP OF BAJA CALIFORNIA
cycloneMessage.message:
ZCZC MIATCPEP4 ALL TTAA00 KNHC DDHHMM
BULLETIN Tropical Storm Hilary Advisory Number 30 NWS National Hurricane Center Miami FL EP092017 200 PM PDT Fri Jul 28 2017
...HILARY CONTINUES NORTHWESTWARD...
SUMMARY OF 200 PM PDT...2100 UTC...INFORMATION ---------------------------------------------- LOCATION...19.7N 119.2W ABOUT 640 MI...1025 KM WSW OF THE SOUTHERN TIP OF BAJA CALIFORNIA MAXIMUM SUSTAINED WINDS...65 MPH...100 KM/H PRESENT MOVEMENT...NW OR 305 DEGREES AT 9 MPH...15 KM/H MINIMUM CENTRAL PRESSURE...996 MB...29.42 INCHES
WATCHES AND WARNINGS -------------------- There are no coastal watches or warnings in effect.
DISCUSSION AND 48-HOUR OUTLOOK ------------------------------ At 200 PM PDT (2100 UTC), the center of Tropical Storm Hilary was located near latitude 19.7 North, longitude 119.2 West. Hilary is moving toward the northwest near 9 mph (15 km/h). A west-northwest to northwest motion with an increase in forward speed is expected through the weekend.
Maximum sustained winds are near 65 mph (100 km/h) with higher gusts. Gradual weakening is expected for the next several days.
Tropical-storm-force winds extend outward up to 105 miles (165 km) from the center.
The estimated minimum central pressure is 996 mb (29.42 inches).
HAZARDS AFFECTING LAND ---------------------- None.
NEXT ADVISORY ------------- Next complete advisory at 800 PM PDT.
$$ Forecaster Zelinsky
NNNN
